verses.verse: There <S%H3426>is<s%> an <S%H7451>evil<s%> which I have <S%H7200>seen<s%> under the <S%H8121>sun<s%>, and it is <S%H7227>heavy<s%> upon <S%H120>men<s%>:

a <S%H376>man<s%> to whom <S%H430>God<s%> <S%H5414>giveth<s%> <S%H6239>riches<s%>, <S%H6239>wealth<s%>, and <S%H3519>honor<s%>, so that he <S%H2638>lacketh<s%> nothing for his <S%H5315>soul<s%> of all that he <S%H183>desireth<s%>, yet <S%H430>God<s%> giveth him not <S%H7980>power<s%> to <S%H398>eat<s%> <S%H376>thereof<s%>, but an alien <S%H398>eateth<s%> <S%H1892>it<s%>; this is vanity, and it is an <S%H7451>evil<s%> <S%H2483>disease<s%>.

If a <S%H376>man<s%> <S%H3205>beget<s%> a <S%H3967>hundred<s%> <S%H2421>children<s%>, and live <S%H7227>many<s%> <S%H8141>years<s%>, so that the <S%H3117>days<s%> of his <S%H8141>years<s%> are <S%H7227>many<s%>, but his <S%H5315>soul<s%> be not <S%H7646>filled<s%> with <S%H2896>good<s%>, and moreover he have no <S%H6900>burial<s%>; I <S%H559>say<s%>, that an untimely <S%H5309>birth<s%> is better than <S%H2896>he<s%>:
for it <S%H935>cometh<s%> in <S%H1892>vanity<s%>, and <S%H3212>departeth<s%> in <S%H2822>darkness<s%>, and the <S%H8034>name<s%> thereof is <S%H3680>covered<s%> with <S%H2822>darkness<s%>;
moreover it hath not <S%H7200>seen<s%> the <S%H8121>sun<s%> nor <S%H3045>known<s%> <S%H2088>it<s%>; this hath <S%H5183>rest<s%> rather than the <S%H2088>other<s%>:

yea <S%H432><s%>, though he <S%H2421>live<s%> a <S%H505>thousand<s%> <S%H8141>years<s%> <S%H6471>twice<s%> <S%H7200>told<s%>, and yet enjoy no <S%H2896>good<s%>, do not all <S%H1980>go<s%> to <S%H259>one<s%> <S%H4725>place<s%>?
All the <S%H5999>labor<s%> of <S%H120>man<s%> is for his <S%H6310>mouth<s%>, and yet the <S%H5315>appetite<s%> is not <S%H4390>filled<s%>.

For what advantage hath the <S%H2450>wise<s%> <S%H3148>more<s%> than the <S%H3684>fool<s%>? or what hath the <S%H6041>poor<s%> <S%H3045>man<s%>, that knoweth how to <S%H1980>walk<s%> before the <S%H2416>living<s%>?

Better <S%H2896><s%> is the <S%H4758>sight<s%> of the <S%H5869>eyes<s%> than the <S%H1980>wandering<s%> of the <S%H5315>desire<s%>: this also is <S%H1892>vanity<s%> and a <S%H7469>striving<s%> after <S%H7307>wind<s%>.

Whatsoever hath <S%H7121>been<s%>, the name thereof was given long <S%H3528>ago<s%>; and it is <S%H3045>known<s%> what <S%H120>man<s%> <S%H3201>is<s%>; neither can he <S%H1777>contend<s%> with him that is mightier than <S%H8623>he<s%>.
Seeing there <S%H3426>are<s%> <S%H7235>many<s%> <S%H1697>things<s%> that <S%H7235>increase<s%> <S%H1892>vanity<s%>, what is <S%H120>man<s%> the <S%H3148>better<s%>?

For who <S%H3045>knoweth<s%> what is <S%H2896>good<s%> for <S%H120>man<s%> in his <S%H2416>life<s%>, <S%H4557>all<s%> the <S%H3117>days<s%> of his <S%H1892>vain<s%> <S%H2416>life<s%> which he <S%H6213>spendeth<s%> as a <S%H6738>shadow<s%>? for who can <S%H5046>tell<s%> a <S%H120>man<s%> what shall be <S%H310>after<s%> him under the <S%H8121>sun<s%>?
